body.p:
County of Shelby
State of Kentucky

His Excellency Hon B Magoffin
Govenor of Kentucky

We the undersigned respectfully ask your to remit the fine imposed on L B Whitaker on the 11th day of Sept 1861 in the case of Commonwealth vs L B Whitaker W E Whitaker & C D Cooper The facts are as follows W E Whitaker alleged that Cooper said he was in favor of expelling all the Southern Rights men from the county Cooper went to the Blacksmith shop. of the Messrs Whitaker and a fight ensued both parties being damaged slightly. No one was present at the commencement no one saw who committed the assault on being arraigned L B Whitaker was fined $27 and costs. Mr Whitaker is a peaceable mane and his character he prays a remittance of the fine imposed upon him

L. B. Whitaker Petitioner

Personally appeared W. W. Easley on of the signers of this petition and made Oath that he saw thirty-^two^ of the signers to the within petition sign their names and authorised others to sign their names to the within Petition this 16th September 1861

Thomas Parker
Examiner of Shelby County Ky

Also L. B. Whittaker made oath that the statements made in the foregoing petition is true this 16th day
of September 1861
Thos Parker Examiner of Shelby Cty.

I do certify that I have been acquainted with Mr L. B. Whittaker for some Eight years and know him to be a peacible citizen a poor man with a large family. And believe that the fine should be remitted. I am also well acquainted with all the Jurors in said action and know them to be violently opposed to Whitaker and could not do him Justice in fact the whole court constable & all this 16th day of September 1861

Shelby J. P.
